i1.name: Adaptive Defenses
description: {{sbc|Innate:}} Periodically, '''Camille's''' next [[basic attack]] against enemy champions is enhanced to {{tip|shield}} her for {{as|20% of her '''maximum''' health}} for 2 seconds from either exclusively {{tip|physical damage|{{as|physical damage}}}} or {{tip|magic damage|{{as|magic damage}}}}, based on which type would mitigate the most damage from her target.
i1.notes:
* The shield-typing is determined based on the total damage the target has dealt to champions that game (as a percentage) versus Camille's current armor and magic resistance.
** For example, with little bonus resistances Camille would likely gain the most obvious shield-typing - i.e. physical versus marksmen and magical versus mages. However, with a full-armor build - she may gain a magic damage shield versus a target like {{ci|Kog'Maw}}, as his physical threat is already mitigated by the armor.
* What shield she will gain is displayed as an icon beneath an enemy's health bar: Orange for Physical or Blue for Magical.

w1.name: Tactical Sweep
description: {{sbc|Active:}} '''Camille''' becomes {{tip|ghosted}} and after a {{fd|1.1}} second delay, she sweeps her leg to deal {{as|physical damage}} to all enemies in a cone in the target direction, becoming unable to declare basic attacks for the duration.

Enemies hit by the outer half of the cone take {{as|'''bonus''' physical damage}} and are {{tip|slow|slowed}} by 80% that decays over 2 seconds, capped at 300 damage against {{tip|monsters}}. '''Camille''' is {{tip|healing|healed}} for the '''bonus''' damage dealt against enemy {{tip|champions}}.
Non-epic monsters take 50% damage from ''Tactical Sweep''.
''Other abilities can be cast during the animation without cancelling it.''
w1.notes:
* Camille can move during the delay, but the hitbox and '''Camille's model''' are fixed to the initial target direction.
** '''Camille's''' facing-direction, for effects such as {{ai|Petrifying Gaze|Cassiopeia}}, is the direction she is moving, and not the direction the model is facing.
* The 50% damage reduction against non-epic monsters applies after the cap. Because of this the actual cap against non-epic monsters is 150 damage.
* Using {{ii|Tiamat}} will cancel the animation, but the sweep will still strike and '''Camille''' will still be unable to basic attack.

r1.name: The Hextech Ultimatum
description: {{sbc|Active:}} '''Camille''' becomes {{tip|untargetable}} and {{tip|dash|leaps}} {{tip|unstoppable|unstoppably}} towards the target enemy {{tip|champion|champion}}, {{tip|disrupt|disrupting}} their ongoing {{tip|channel|channels}}.
When she lands, she creates a hexagonal zone around the target's current location for a duration, {{tip|airborne|knocking away}} all other nearby enemies on impact.
The target cannot escape the zone through any means. While within the zone, '''Camille's''' basic attacks deal {{tip|magic damage|{{as|'''bonus''' magic damage}}}}.
''The Hextech Ultimatum'' ends automatically within 1 second if '''Camille''' leaves the area or dies.
r1.notes:
* '''Camille''' will attempt to basic attack the target.
* The trapped victim is locked out from casting {{si|Flash}} until ''Hextech Ultimatum'' ends.
** {{Pending for test}}: {{si|Teleport}}, {{si|Hexflash}}, {{si|Mark}} / {{si|Dash}}, and {{si|Recall}}.
* The ability will cancel and go on {{sti|cooldown}} and expend {{sti|{{as|mana}}}} if the target {{tip|death|dies}} or becomes {{tip|untargetable}} during the dash.
* '''Camille''' will follow targets that change locations (e.g. {{tip|airborne|displacements}}, {{tip|blink|blinks}}, {{tip|dash|dashes}}) but not those that exceed the range limit, in which case ''The Hextech Ultimatum'' is cancelled and goes on {{sti|cooldown}} and expends {{sti|{{as|mana}}}}.
* {{tip|Airborne|Knockaway}} speed is 1000.
* The boundaries are not considered terrain ({{ai|Unstoppable Onslaught|Sion|exception}}), and enemies that try to move out of the area will be displaced back inside.
** Abilities such as {{ai|Comet of Legend|Aurelion Sol}} and {{ai|Keeper's Verdict|Poppy}} will cap their effect range to the boundary. Targets will stop at the boundary even after it expired.
** {{cai|Chronobreak|Ekko}} will still deal damage at the hologram's location.
** {{cai|Devour|Tahm Kench}} can carry ''Camille's'' target outside of the area, but they will be displaced back inside once {{ai|Regurgitate|Tahm Kench|Regurgitated}}. 
** An active {{ai|Assault and Battery|Vi}} on a target outside the perimeter will cause {{ci|Vi}} to continue her charge until ''The Hextech Ultimatum'' ends. She can knockback and damage secondary targets multiple times.
** {{ai|Living Shadow|Zed|Shadows}} placed outside of the hexagonal zone by {{ci|Zed}} can be swapped with but he will only {{tip|blink}} to the nearest position towards his [[File:Zed's Shadow.png|20px|border]] ''Shadow'' while still being unable to escape in ''The Hextech Ultimatum''.
** If the target {{tip|attached|attaches}} to a unit, they will only be displaced back inside once they detach. ''The Hextech Ultimatum'' does not end nor break the bind to the victim. Effects such as {{cai|You and Me!|Yuumi}} or {{cai|Umbral Trespass|Kayn}} allow them to bypass the borders if the unit they're attached to leaves the area.

effects.str: • Bonus Magic Damage: (+ % of target's current health)
